summary: This document is a list of exhibits for Chapter 2 of a report, likely from the U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG). It catalogs documents related to the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody, including legal filings, prison records, and Bureau of Prisons policies. The list highlights the indictment and subsequent legal proceedings against correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the case, an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York who died while in custody. The list references his indictment and a BOP psychological reconstruction.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: A correctional officer at MCC New York who was indicted for alleged failures related to Epstein's custody and later entered into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: A correctional officer at MCC New York who was indicted alongside Tova Noel for alleged failures related to Epstein's custody and later entered into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

connections.description: Indicted together for alleged failures in their duties related to the custody and monitoring of Jeffrey Epstein.
Noel was a correctional officer assigned to the Special Housing Unit where Epstein was held.
Thomas was a correctional officer assigned to the Special Housing Unit where Epstein was held.

events.title: Epstein Indictment in SDNY
events.description: An indictment was filed against Jeffrey Epstein in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Decision to Remand Epstein
events.description: A court order was filed remanding defendant Jeffrey Epstein, denying bail.

events.title: SHU Check Sheet (Night Before Death)
events.description: A 30-minute check sheet was completed for the Special Housing Unit (SHU) L-Tier at MCC New York, the night before Epstein's death.

events.title: SHU Check Sheet (Day of Death)
events.description: A 30-minute check sheet was completed for the Special Housing Unit (SHU) ZA, Tier-G at MCC New York, the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead.

events.title: Indictment of Correctional Officers
events.description: An indictment was filed against correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas.

events.title: Deferred Prosecution Agreements
events.description: Deferred Prosecution Agreements were filed for both Tova Noel and Michael Thomas.

events.title: Nolle Prosequi for Officers
events.description: A nolle prosequi (declination to prosecute) was filed, ending the criminal case against Tova Noel and Michael Thomas.

keyFacts: The document is an exhibit list for a DOJ OIG report investigating the circumstances of Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.
It reveals the indictment and subsequent legal resolution (Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Nolle Prosequi) for correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas.
Specific prison records from the nights surrounding Epstein's death (August 9-10, 2019) are listed as key evidence.
The list includes a wide range of Bureau of Prisons policies and regulations relevant to inmate custody, suicide prevention, and staff conduct.
The case number 2019.010614 is identified as the OIG's investigation into Epstein's death.
